title: What is the legend of Saturn in Lazio and how does it connect to the traditional doctrine of cycles and the hidden teachings of an initiatic center?
first_phrase: This text explores the legend of Saturn in ancient Rome, and its connection to the traditional doctrine of cycles. Saturn allegedly taught agriculture and navigation to the people of Lazio, and some believed that an ancient Saturnian race still lived according to their customs. The legend links Saturn to the Golden Age and claims that he hid in Lazio to transmit his teachings secretly. The myth suggests that the Roman tradition of Wisdom derived from the primordial age, and it exists underground in an initiatic center. Saturn also gave humans prosperity and freedom celebrated in the Saturnalia festival.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the teaching of Saturn is deeply connected to the primordial tradition of the Golden Age and is transmitted secretly in Lazio. The legend holds a precise meaning for those who have reason to recognize the existence of a supreme initiatic center hidden beneath the earth--a link stated by Virgil and confirmed by Ovid. The Saturnalia festivities celebrated by the Romans in December were not only marked by licentiousness but also had an initiatic character, as stated by the Latin writer Macrobio. The legacy of Saturn continues to inspire us today.
